com.snap2d.sound
Class SoundMap

java.lang.Object
  com.snap2d.sound.SoundMap

public class SoundMap
extends Object

Provides management of sound sources in a 2-dimensional sound space. It is highly recommended that only one instance of this class exists at a time in an application process. While it isn't necessarily wrong to create more than one instance, and there may be certain circumstances under which this is the correct design to use, for most practical uses a one-instance only rule should be preferred. All SoundMap objects will inherently use the same SoundSystem, as only one should exist in the application. Therefore, only one listener location may be set (hence why it's a static member of SoundMap), and the implementer must be careful, if using multiple instances, not to overlap source identifiers with other SoundMap objects (they link to the same system). Therefore, in the interest of simplicity and safety, it should be preferred to keep only one instance of SoundMap active in your application at a time.

Author:
Brian Groenke
